title: TreeItem
name: TreeItem
description:
Populates a tree control, created with cftree, with elements. You can use the img values
  supplied with CFML or reference your own icons.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Value passed when the cfform is submitted. When populating a cftree with data from a
	cfquery, columns are specified in a comma-separated list.

attributes.name: display
attributes.description:
The label for the tree item. Default is value. When populating a cftree with data from a
	cfquery, display names are specified in a comma-separated list.

attributes.name: img
attributes.description:
Image name or filename for the tree item. When populating a cftree with data from a cfquery,
	images or filenames for each level of the tree are specified in a comma-separated list.

attributes.name: imgopen
attributes.description: Icon displayed with open tree item. You can specify the icon filename using a relative path.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
URL to associate with the tree item or a query column for a tree that is populated from a query.
	If href is a query column, the href value is the value populated by the query. If href is not
	recognized as a query column, it is assumed that the href text is an actual HTML href.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Target attribute for href URL. When populating a cftree with data from a cfquery, targets are specified in a
	comma-separated list.

attributes.name: query
attributes.description: Query name used to generate data for the treeitem.

attributes.name: queryAsRoot
attributes.description:
Yes or No. Defines specified query as the root level. As in Example 1, this option avoids
	having to create an additional parent cftreeitem. If you specify a text string other than Yes or
	No, the tag uses the text as the root text.

attributes.name: expand
attributes.description:
Yes or No. Yes expands tree to show tree item children. No keeps tree item collapsed.
	Default is Yes
